content: c r o c h e t p u m p k i n m a t e r i a l s a b b r e v i a t i o n s chain - chain approximately 50 yds lion brand wool ease rs - right side thick & quick 1 full ball makes 2 pumpkins ws - wrong side or equivalent super bulky yarn half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet contrasting color yarn cinnamon stick twig or st s - stitch es fabric for stem lp - loop size n13/9mm crochet hook polyester fiberfill no gauge finished pumpkin size tapestry needle depends on amount of stuffing sample scissors pumpkin is 5in wide and 4in tall throughout ch2 does not count towards stitches 1 © 2020 adrienne sullivan design p u m p k i n b o d y s t e p 1 s t e p 2 chain 22 row 1 rs half_double_crochet in 3rd chain from hook and in each chain across 20 sts chain 2 turn s t e p 3 s t e p 4 row 2 ws half_double_crochet in back lp only across row 3-20 repeat row 2 chain 2 turn s t e p 5 s t e p 6 cut yarn leaving a 30in tail fold work in half so that beginning chain is touching last row rs facing out 2 p u m p k i n b o d y s t e p 7 s t e p 8 using tapestry needle whipstitch beginning thread yarn tail through every other edge st chain to inside loop of end row and cinch tight secure with a knot but do not cut yarn s t e p 9 s t e p 1 0 fill open end with polyester fiberfill push tapestry needle with tail yarn through center of closed end through the fiberfill and out the open end s t e p 1 1 s t e p 1 2 weave tail yarn through every other edge st secure with knot trim yarn and weave and cinch tight both closing the hole and in ends pulling the pumpkin flatter 3 s t e m s t e p 1 s t e p 2 make an magic_ring or ch1 and single_crochet 4 in single_crochet on top of first st to join in the round that space s t e p 3 s t e p 4 single_crochet around for 7 rounds cut yarn leaving a use remaining tail yarn to sew to pumpkin 10in tail top alternatively affix a twig or cinnamon stick using hot glue or sew on a fabric stem 4 © 2020 adrienne sullivan design
